result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Adam Plautz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court allows wage assignment to continue, until fines are paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Adam Plautz

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 11:29 AM Defendant Justin Adam Plautz in court.  Attorney Michael Hughes appeared by video for Justin Adam Plautz.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Huges has went over complaint and filed PLQ, recites agreement, count one would be amend to misd posses of THC - plea of guilty, count 2 would be DRI. Joint recommendation fine of $1000 plus court costs. All parties agree. Court DRI count 2, amends count one to misd of possession of THC. Plautz pleads guilty to the amended charge. Court goes over PLQ form, finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to trial, accepts plea of guilty and adjudges guilty. State asks court to follow joint recommendation. Attorney Hughes makes statement, asks for wage assignment to continue to apply to fines/charges and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Plautz makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements, considered all factors, accepted responsibility, accepts joint recommendation and sentences to the following: Count 1 - imposes fine of $1000 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, submit bill to county, court will allow wage assignment to continue to pay fines/charges, DNA sample with surcharges. Appeal rights given.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Justin Adam Plautz in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, did previously determine that the defendant did not qualify for court appointed counsel, asks if he has hired counsel yet. Plautz responds, has been looking and states he cannot come up with the retainer fee, has contacted several attorneys. Court will reconsider his previous denial, will appoint an attorney for him, pay $200.00/month commencing 9/15/22, sets for AIA on 10/5/22 at 1030 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Adam Plautz in court. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has, to see how much one would cost, as he does not qualify for SPD. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney; private hire, SPD or court appointed if not eligible for SPD. Defendant understands, has paperwork for court appointed attorney as he is unable to afford a private attorney. Clerk confirms and instructs him to bring paperwork to JA. Court sets bond at $2000 signature bond and will have scheduled for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2022 at 10:45 am.
